channel.title: Domain on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Domain on TLDRBins

item.title: DNS Enum
item.description: Zone Transfer dig +noall +answer <DOMAIN> axfr @<TARGET> Domain Discovery dig +noall +answer @<TARGET> <DOMAIN> dig +noall +answer @<TARGET> -x <TARGET> dig +noall +answer @<TARGET> +short <DOMAIN> any dig +noall +answer @<TARGET> -t NS <DOMAIN>

item.title: SMB Enum
item.description: SMB Share Enum nmap sudo nmap --script=smb-enum-shares -p 445 <TARGET> Anonymous Login smbmap smbclient impacket smbmap -H <TARGET> --no-banner smbmap -H <TARGET> -u null --no-banner # List known share smbmap -H <TARGET> -r <SHARE> smbclient -N -L \\\\<TARGET>\\ # After found an accessible share smbclient -N \\\\<TARGET>\\<SHARE>\\ # Fix: Unable to initialize messaging context. protocol negotiation failed: NT_STATUS_CONNECTION_DISCONNECTED smbclient -N -L \\\\<TARGET>\\ --option='client min protocol=NT1' # SID brute, if null auth allowed impacket-lookupsid test@<DOMAIN> -no-pass Authenticated smbmap smbclient smbmap -H <TARGET> -u <USER> -p '<PASSWORD>' # List known share smbmap -H <TARGET> -u <USER> -p '<PASSWORD>' -R <SHARE> # Download file smbmap -H <TARGET> -r <SHARE> --download <PATH_TO_FILE> # List files with regex pattern smbmap -H <TARGET> -u <USER> -p '<PASSWORD>' -r <SHARE> -A <FILE_PATTERN> smbclient -L \\\\<TARGET>\\ -U '<DOMAIN>/<USER>%<PASSWORD>' # After found an accessible share smbclient \\\\<TARGET>\\<SHARE>\\ -U '<DOMAIN>/<USER>%<PASSWORD>' Authenticated with Kerberos impacket impacket-smbclient '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET_DOMAIN>' -k -no-pass Basic commands # List all files in a share recurse ON ls # Download all files mask "" recurse ON prompt OFF mget * List Alternate Data Streams (ADS) allinfo <FILE> # Example Response >>>stream: [:Password:$DATA], 15 bytes # Download specific data stream get "<FILE>:Password" Mount SMB Share Anonymous Authenticated sudo mount -t cifs //<TARGET>/<SHARE> /mnt sudo mount -t cifs -o ro,user=<USER>,password='<PASSWORD>' //<TARGET>/<SHARE> /mnt Check write permission sudo find .

item.title: Subdomain Enum
item.description: Add domain/subdomain to /etc/hosts echo "<TARGET> <DOMAIN>" | sudo tee -a /etc/hosts wfuzz gobuster wfuzz -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/DNS/bitquark-subdomains-top100000.txt -H "Host: FUZZ.<DOMAIN>" -u http://<DOMAIN> Take note of the word size, Ctrl+C to interrupt the process, then run again wfuzz -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/DNS/bitquark-subdomains-top100000.txt -H "Host: FUZZ.<DOMAIN>" -u http://<DOMAIN> --hw 10 Filter out response with header # For example: Access-Control-Allow-Origin wfuzz -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/DNS/bitquark-subdomains-top100000.txt -H "Origin: http://FUZZ.<DOMAIN>" --filter "r.headers.response ~ 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin'" -u http://<DOMAIN> gobuster vhost -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/DNS/bitquark-subdomains-top100000.

item.title: Web Directory Enum
item.description: feroxbuster wfuzz gobuster bfac ds_walk HTTP feroxbuster -u http://<TARGET>/ --depth 1 --methods=GET,POST -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/Web-Content/raft-medium-directories.txt --dont-extract-links HTTPS feroxbuster -u https://<TARGET>/ -k --depth 1 --methods=GET,POST -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/Web-Content/raft-medium-directories.txt --dont-extract-links Specify Extension feroxbuster -u http://<TARGET>/ --methods=GET,POST --depth=1 -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/Web-Content/raft-medium-words.txt -x html, asp, aspx Add trailing slash '/' to each request feroxbuster -u http://<TARGET>/ -f --depth 1 --methods=GET,POST -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/Web-Content/raft-medium-directories.txt API Fuzzing feroxbuster -u http://<TARGET>/ --force-recursion -C 404,405 --methods=GET,POST -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/Web-Content/raft-medium-directories.txt Fuzzing Number Range wfuzz -z range,1-99 http://<TARGET>/users/FUZZ gobuster dir -u http://<TARGET> -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/Web-Content/raft-medium-words.

item.title: whois
item.description: WHOIS # General whois <DOMAIN> # With specific server whois -h <WHOIS_SERVER> -p 43 <DOMAIN>
